name: Doro Wat
description: A popular and spicy Ethiopian chicken stew, Doro Wat is known for its deep, fiery red color due to a generous amount of berbere spice. It's traditionally served with injera (Ethiopian sourdough flatbread) and hard-boiled eggs.
steps: Marinate chicken pieces in lemon juice and salt.
Cook onions in a dry pot until golden, then add berbere spice and oil, cooking into a paste.
Add garlic and ginger, then the marinated chicken, stirring to coat with the spice mixture.
Add enough water to cover, bring to a boil, then simmer until the chicken is tender.
Add hard-boiled eggs to the stew in the last 10 minutes.
tips: Make sure the onions are fully caramelized before adding the berbere to develop a deeper flavor.
Adjust the amount of berbere for desired spice level.
Score the eggs with a knife before adding them to the stew to allow flavors to penetrate.
